messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] School thoughts from Pooh book
messages.msgSnippet: I would love to get a portrait of my kids.  Let me know if you decide to do that and how it turns out. Bonnie ...
messages.messageBody:
I would love to get a portrait of my kids. Let me know if you decide to do
that and how it turns out.

Bonnie


>From: Tamilooch@...
>Reply-To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
>To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
>Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] School thoughts from Pooh book
>Date: Mon, 24 Jul 2000 23:53:22 EDT
>
>Hello Bonnie,
>The ADDICTION.. will wear off, I could have kept going with just about
>every
>animal possible. My hubby hates to tattoo me because ALL of my tatttoos
>HAVE
>to be realistic and there are not enough pictures to go by and it is
>difficult to make line sheets from books. I am saving skin for 2
>more.......
>family will really love me. A friend of ours (also a tattoo artist) drew a
>sketch of my daughter and it came out beautiful and very realistic, hubby
>is
>afraid that it wont come out the same in ink as it did in pencil. So I have
>been procrastinating wether or not to get it. The other one is of a
>beautiful
>black stallion with his mane all flowing and his nostrils all flared while
>he
>is thundering across some open field in all his freedom. You have to see
>it
>to appreciate . Its so beautiful I almost cried when I saw it. The trouble
>is
>with the line sheets , they can be so difficult and I really dont want to
>ruin such a picture.
>
>Tamie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] School thoughts from Pooh book
messages.msgSnippet: Hello Amy, I will post you later on tonight Im kind of in a hurry , but didnt want you to think that I wasnt responding. If you have a picture or something
messages.messageBody:
Hello Amy,
I will post you later on tonight Im kind of in a hurry , but didnt want you
to think that I wasnt responding. If you have a picture or something then
they can go by that. Look through the coloring books and any pooh books and
see if you like anything, they also have quite a few Pooh characters there
that you could pick from and you could get any size that you want , they
will play with it until you approve. anyway gotta go . Talk to you later.

Tamie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] School thoughts from Pooh book
messages.msgSnippet: I was planning on going to salem to get it anyway. The problem that I have is I m being very specific in what I want. I want a small (no more than 1-1 1/2 in.)
messages.messageBody:
I was planning on going to salem to get it anyway. The problem that I have
is I'm being very specific in what I want. I want a small (no more than 1-1
1/2 in.) Eeyore. Does he have anything like that? Also, If I get more than
one the same day is it the same price or is it per tatoo?. You can post off
list if you'd like. I also need specific directions. I assume you're right
near the mall.
Amy
----- Original Message -----
From: <Tamilooch@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Sent: Monday, July 24, 2000 11:58 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] School thoughts from Pooh book


> Hi Amy,
> We are in Salem NH. You may of heard of all the shops on Rt. 28 in Salem.
> There are plenty. But if you decide to cross the border we are at Ed's
> Heritage , just ask for Russ. He always does my friends for almost free ,
> minus the $40.00 needles. They all love this because some of the tattoos
go
> for big money. The 40. covers his needles and supplies the tattoo goes for
> free. (just to let everyone know, Because I know your all curious . The
> needles are always brand new and COMPLETELY sterilized. and I make them
> myself with TLC) sorry I had to say that alot of people want to know that.
> Tamie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] School thoughts from Pooh book
messages.msgSnippet: First hubby was my piece of art.  I don t do anything with needles cause I bruise if they come within a foot of my hide!  Sooo, to quell the itch I
messages.messageBody:
First hubby was "my" piece of art. I don't "do" anything with needles
cause I bruise if they come within a foot of my hide! Sooo, to quell the
itch I designed them and had them put on hubby <g> Good thing he had broad
shoulders (ex-football player <g>) cause I was a busy little bee there for
awhile! I hauled him down to SF a couple of times and had Lyle Tuttle put
a couple of them on him. There was a guy named Ernie that did some really
beautiful work that I had so most of the rest of them on him. Ernie was
the only artist I ever saw that could do beautiful work with browns and
yellows and did portraits that looked like they came off a canvas. Don't
know whatever happened to him but he did some beautiful work on his wife
including a grizzly bear that looked like it was going to jump off her back
and come after ya!

Lynda

----------
> From: Tamilooch@...
> To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] School thoughts from Pooh book
> Date: Monday, July 24, 2000 9:02 PM

> I havent heard of her, but will be on the lookout for her in our mags.
There
> are alot of very talented people in the bus. Im glad some of the
stereotype
> has dropped about people with tattoos . I have only been insulted twice
by
> strangers and they were both male. That only men get tattoos and how
unlady
> like it was of me to do that. Do you know what I said to them.
>
> Plththhththth!
>
> Raspberries to them.
> Tamie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] School thoughts from Pooh book
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Lynda, I havent heard of her, but will be on the lookout for her in our mags. There are alot of very talented people in the bus. Im glad some of the
messages.messageBody:
Hi Lynda,
I havent heard of her, but will be on the lookout for her in our mags. There
are alot of very talented people in the bus. Im glad some of the stereotype
has dropped about people with tattoos . I have only been insulted twice by
strangers and they were both male. That only men get tattoos and how unlady
like it was of me to do that. Do you know what I said to them.

Plththhththth!

Raspberries to them.
Tamie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] School thoughts from Pooh book
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Amy, We are in Salem NH. You may of heard of all the shops on Rt. 28 in Salem. There are plenty. But if you decide to cross the border we are at Ed s
messages.messageBody:
Hi Amy,
We are in Salem NH. You may of heard of all the shops on Rt. 28 in Salem.
There are plenty. But if you decide to cross the border we are at Ed's
Heritage , just ask for Russ. He always does my friends for almost free ,
minus the $40.00 needles. They all love this because some of the tattoos go
for big money. The 40. covers his needles and supplies the tattoo goes for
free. (just to let everyone know, Because I know your all curious . The
needles are always brand new and COMPLETELY sterilized. and I make them
myself with TLC) sorry I had to say that alot of people want to know that.
Tamie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] School thoughts from Pooh book
messages.msgSnippet: Hello Bonnie, The ADDICTION..  will wear off, I could have kept going with just about every animal possible. My hubby hates to tattoo me because ALL of my
messages.messageBody:
Hello Bonnie,
The ADDICTION.. will wear off, I could have kept going with just about every
animal possible. My hubby hates to tattoo me because ALL of my tatttoos HAVE
to be realistic and there are not enough pictures to go by and it is
difficult to make line sheets from books. I am saving skin for 2 more.......
family will really love me. A friend of ours (also a tattoo artist) drew a
sketch of my daughter and it came out beautiful and very realistic, hubby is
afraid that it wont come out the same in ink as it did in pencil. So I have
been procrastinating wether or not to get it. The other one is of a beautiful
black stallion with his mane all flowing and his nostrils all flared while he
is thundering across some open field in all his freedom. You have to see it
to appreciate . Its so beautiful I almost cried when I saw it. The trouble is
with the line sheets , they can be so difficult and I really dont want to
ruin such a picture.

Tamie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] School thoughts from Pooh book
messages.msgSnippet: Hello Tamie, do you know Amy in Florida?  She s an unschooler who has a whole body of tatoos that are quite beautiful and her hubby is also an artist.  They
messages.messageBody:
Hello Tamie, do you know Amy in Florida? She's an unschooler who has a
whole body of tatoos that are quite beautiful and her hubby is also an
artist. They just opened a new shop. She's been in a couple of the
magazines.

Lynda

> coverable when they need to be. Except for my wolf and I wouldnt want to

>
> Sorry I didnt mean to go on. Hubby HAS rubbed off on me.
>
> Tamie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] School thoughts from Pooh book
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Amy, Come on over, my hubby is a Tattoo Artist. (I have lots of color!! BEG) My favorites are wolves . I also have them everywhere not on my body I only
messages.messageBody:
Hi Amy,
Come on over, my hubby is a Tattoo Artist. (I have lots of color!! BEG)


My favorites are wolves . I also have them everywhere not on my body I only
have one of a wolf and a lion cub and a cheetah and the moon and the stars
with leaves. Family says its time to end the Animal Kingdom Billboard.
(another BEG) I dont know what they are so worried about most of them are
coverable when they need to be. Except for my wolf and I wouldnt want to
cover him anyway. He is beautiful.

Sorry I didnt mean to go on. Hubby HAS rubbed off on me.

Tamie

messages.messageBody:
Amy,

The strange parallels continue. I was considering getting a Tigger tattoo
at some point. Eeyore is my second favorite.

Your evil twin,

Bonnie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] School thoughts from Pooh book
messages.msgSnippet: Hi guys, My daughter and I got a Pooh book from the library about school.  rolling my eyes  She loves anything with Pooh.  As I was reading it, I was think
messages.messageBody:
Hi guys,
My daughter and I got a Pooh book from the library about school. >rolling my
eyes> She loves anything with Pooh. As I was reading it, I was think of
this list. I wanted to share some of the comments in it.

"This schooling business-pencils and whatnot-it's overrated if you ask me."
(says Eeyore)

Later .. "If you have to go that far from home, I'm sure school is not a good
thing for Piglets, " said Piglet.

A page or two later, Tigger is discussing bouncing in school. Here is the
conversation: "there's no bouncing in school,"said Eeyore decisively.
"None?" asked Tigger. "School is work. No time for fun, " said Eeyore.

hummmmmmm, need I say more. ........Of course the book goes on to say what
neat things you learn in school like ABC and counting, but we all know these
things are easier to learn when we are having fun.

Julie
